speaker: Aegis
lines: You press your brow to stone. Breath plumes like incense.
The world narrows to heartbeat and frost. Then the mountain answers.
It does not speak in words so much as weightâ€”your bones feel correctly arranged.
The ache in your knees becomes a kind of music you know how to dance.
You remember the names of snow you have never seen, and how each melts differently.
When you stand, your shadow fits the shrine's outline as if meant.
